title: A 17-month-old, a 15-year-old, and a postal worker are among the 7 victims in the Odessa, Texas shooting rampage
text:
Seven people were killed and 21 were injured after a gunman opened fire on authorities during a traffic stop before firing at strangers from a moving vehicle, police said.

Though police have not released an official list of victims, initial details about some of those who were injured and killed in the attacks began to emerge from victims' families and authorities on Sunday.

After the suspect fled the scene of the traffic stop, he hijacked a mail carrier truck and went on to shoot at residents and law-enforcement officers in Odessa, Texas before authorities caught up with him near a movie theater and killed him in a shootout.

US Postal Service worker Mary Granados was shot and killed when the gunman stole her truck as she was delivering mail, The Daily Mail reported, citing a coworker.

Mary Grenados. GoFundMe

Anderson Davis (pictured in the top photo), a 17-month-old girl, was injured when she shot in the face Saturday. According to a GoFundMe page created by a family friend, the toddler had shrapnel in her right chest, a hole through her bottom lip and tongue, and her front teeth knocked out in the attack.

"She is alive. When others today are not alive," Anderson's mother said in a statement shared on the GoFundMe page. "I ask you to continue praying for our hearts as we experience this, pray for complete healing of Anderson, pray for every other family in our same situation, or worse, today and pray for the shooters. Pray that whatever is causing them to do this will be defeated by God and they will stop shooting."

The Daily Mail also reported that 15-year-old high school student Leila Hernandez was among those killed. An Odessa High School student was among the seven who were killed, NBC News reported as confirmed by the Ector County Independent School District, but it's unclear if the student was Hernandez.

Leila Hernandez (center). Facebook

Hernandez's brother Nathan was also injured in the rampage and underwent surgery, according to a GoFundMe page that has raised over $16,000 for the Hernandez family as of Sunday afternoon.

Police have not released the identities of all of the victims, but said that they range in age from 15 to 57.

Three law enforcement officers were wounded in the shooting, including Midland Police Officer Zack Owens. According to a GoFundMe set up by his family, Owens was shot multiple times in the arm and hand and suffered glass shards in his eye.

The gunman is believed to be a white male in his 30s who used an "AR-style" weapon.
description: A 17-month-old, a 15-year-old high school student, and a postal worker have been reported as among the injured and dead after an shooting rampage.
